thread.title: Musician has his bass guitar amplifier head stolen from his parked vehicle: Brooklyn Police Blotter
thread.title_full: Musician has his bass guitar amplifier head stolen from his parked vehicle: Brooklyn Police Blotter | cleveland.com

author: Mark Holan, Special to the Sun News
title: Musician has his bass guitar amplifier head stolen from his parked vehicle: Brooklyn Police Blotter
text:
Theft From Auto, Westbrook Drive: A man had his Hartke bass guitar amplifier head unit stolen from his vehicle parked in the Westbrook Apartments lot Sept. 27. The value of the unit is $500. His girlfriend's wallet was also stolen from the vehicle. There were no signs of forced entry.
Petty Theft, Brookpark Road: A Cleveland man, 23, was caught trying to steal video games at Walmart Sept. 29. The total value of the games is $260.
Petty Theft, Brookpark Road: A Cleveland man, 62, was caught shoplifting at Sam's Club Sept. 29. He tried to steal $254 worth of meat. He was driving a motorized shopping cart.
